articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans fall for second session on slowing U.S. exports; wheat down
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Jan 10 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures lost more ground on Tuesday, with a lack of demand for U.S. supplies weighing on the market, although losses were limited by dry weather curbing yields in key supplier Argentina.Wheat fell for a third consecutive session while corn slid.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active soybean contract on the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) was
articles.content:
SINGAPORE, Jan 10 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures lost more ground on Tuesday, with a lack of demand for U.S. supplies weighing on the market, although losses were limited by dry weather curbing yields in key supplier Argentina.

articles.title: S&P raises Argentina's long-term local currency rating to 'CCC-'
articles.description: Read more about S&P raises Argentina's long-term local currency rating to 'CCC-' on Devdiscourse
articles.content:
Global ratings agency S&P Global on Monday raised its long-term local currency sovereign credit ratings on Argentina to 'CCC-/C' from 'SD/SD' and affirmed its foreign currency ratings at 'CCC+/C'.

articles.title: Argentine artist paints on inflation-hit bank notes
articles.description: Argentina's cash has lost so much value in recent years that local artist Sergio Guillermo Diaz finds painting on even the most valuable banknotes has become affordable.
articles.content:
SALTA, Argentina, Jan 3 (Reuters) - Argentina's cash has lost so much value in recent years that local artist Sergio Guillermo Diaz finds painting on even the most valuable banknotes has become affordable.

articles.title: French Football President Apologises For 'Awkward Remarks' On Zidane After Backlash
articles.description: Zidane was one of the favourites to take charge of the national team if Didier Deschamps had stepped down but his contract was extended after he led France to the World Cup final, where they lost to Argentina in Qatar last month.
articles.content:
France Football Federation (FFF) president Noel Le Graet apologised to Zinedine Zidane on Monday after his comments on the former Real Madrid coach drew the ire of players, politicians and even the Spanish club.

articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans rise on fears drought will cut Argentine crop, wheat firms
articles.description: (Recasts with European trade, adds new comment, changes dateline)By Michael HoganHAMBURG, Jan 9 (Reuters) - Chicago soybeans were supported by fears about dry weather in key supplier Argentina while wheat rose after Friday’s fall and corn was flat.Chicago Board of Trade most-active soybeans rose 0.2% to $14.96-3/4 a bushel at 1206 GMT.
